title: Reinforce the Spring Scheduler with more threads to avoid stall of @Schedule'd tasks
custom_steps:
Yesterday on STG we noticed that several of our scheduled tasks appeared not to be running.    A restart of STG pod cleared it up. 

The theory is that we were using a single thread that the Spring Scheduler defaults to and for whatever reason, that thead was not returned to the thread pool.  

See these articles for more elucidation.

[https://mossgreen.github.io/Spring-Scheduled-Tasks-Stop-Working/|https://mossgreen.github.io/Spring-Scheduled-Tasks-Stop-Working/|smart-link] 

[https://community.pivotal.io/s/article/methods-annotated-with-scheduled-stops-working?language=en_US|https://community.pivotal.io/s/article/methods-annotated-with-scheduled-stops-working?language=en_US|smart-link] 

We should do three things:

#  Add logging for {{org.springframework.scheduling.*}} 
# Tune the thread pool size - as noted in the above article, set it to 25 (good to set as a system property).
# See if thereâ€™s some way we can alert if the jobs are not getting run.   This might be tricky as weâ€™re looking for the absence of something.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want certain player information to be updated from ebis daily
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player is released, and is no longer affiliated, that will be reflected in the portal
** Org/Club will be updated
** Will no longer require Club Comm report
* If a player is signed, and is now considered an affiliated player, that will be reflected in the portal
** Org/Club will be updated
** Will now require Club Comm report
* If a player is added to the 40-man roster, that will be reflected in the portal
** 40-Man flag will be updated
* If a player is removed from the 40-man roster, that will be reflected in the portal
** 40-Man flag will be updated
* If a player is placed on the IL, that will be reflected in the portal
** IL flag will be updated
* If a player is reinstated from the IL, that will be reflected in the portal
** IL flag will be updated

These updates do not need to be real-time.  An overnight batch should work fine.
